title: Education on Utilizing Reference Materials to Improve Scientific Information Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience in academic research searches
context.additional_context: A faculty competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers, tailored for time-constrained professionals in smartphone-centric learning environments, emphasizing information retrieval efficiency and critical evaluation skills in scientific research.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically conduct exploratory approaches to research topics using reference materials from various scientific fields (dictionaries, encyclopedias, review papers, etc.)
Learners can apply ACRL Framework core concepts (authority as constructed, value of information, scholarship as conversation, etc.) to scientific information searches
Learners can design information-seeking strategies using reference materials in mobile environments and apply them to actual research scenarios

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
